Description: Body sherd of Attic black-figured pottery lip-cup with part of offset rim; interior glazed black; exterior: at top, lip glazed; in handle zone, part of handle palmette with some added red in centre; at right, black-figure decoration consisting of male figure's leg and trace of heel; pre-firing inscription between; black below.
Curator's comments: Object owned and held by University College London. This record is included in the British Museum database as part of the Museum’s Naukratis Project, a research collaboration that aims to virtually re-unite finds from the ancient port city of Naukratis, now distributed over 80 museums worldwide.
Beazley suggests that the name on the sherd might refer to either the painter or potter or it might also be a kalos-name.
Bibliographic references: Venit 1982 / Painted Pottery from the Greek Mainland found in Egypt, 640-450 BC (p. 390-1, no. B563, pl. CXCIV)
Villing et al 2013-2015 / Naukratis: Greeks in Egypt (GA.1349) (phase 3)
